1.a: Isaiah predicted that God would send a messenger, a voice of someone calling out in the wilderness, to prepare the way of the Lord.
1.q: What did the prophet Isaiah predict would happen before the Lord came?

1.a: John came preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
1.q: What did John come preaching?

1.a: The people confessed their sins as they were baptized by John.
1.q: What did the people do as they were baptized by John?

1.a: John ate locusts and wild honey.
1.q: What did John eat?

1.a: John said the one coming after him would baptize with the Holy Spirit.
1.q: With what did John say the one coming after him would baptize?

1.a: After being baptized, Jesus saw the heavens split open and the Spirit descend on him as a dove.
1.q: What did Jesus see as he came up out of the water after being baptized by John?

1.a: The voice from heaven said, "You are my beloved Son; I am very pleased with you".
1.q: What did the voice from heaven say after Jesus was baptized?

1.a: The Spirit drove Jesus out into the wilderness.
1.q: Who drove Jesus out into the wilderness?

1.a: Jesus was in the wilderness forty days, and he was tempted by Satan there.
1.q: How long was Jesus in the wilderness, and what happened to him there?

1.a: Jesus preached that the kingdom of God was near, and that people must repent and believe in the gospel.
1.q: What message did Jesus preach?

1.a: Jesus said he would make Simon and Andrew fishers of men.
1.q: What did Jesus say he would make Simon and Andrew?

1.a: Simon and Andrew were fishermen.
1.q: What was the occupation of Simon and Andrew?

1.a: James and John were fishermen.
1.q: What was the occupation of James and John?

1.a: Jesus' teaching astonished the people because Jesus taught as one with authority.
1.q: Why did Jesus' teaching astonish the people in the synagogue?

1.a: The unclean spirit in the synagogue gave Jesus the title of the Holy One of God.
1.q: What title did the unclean spirit in the synagogue give Jesus?

1.a: The news about Jesus went out everywhere.
1.q: What happened with the news about Jesus?

1.a: When they went into Simon's house, Jesus healed Simon's mother-in-law.
1.q: When they went into Simon's house, who did Jesus heal?

1.a: When it was evening, the people brought all who were sick or possessed by demons, and Jesus healed them.
1.q: What happened when it was evening?

1.a: Before the sun rose, Jesus went out to a solitary place and prayed there.
1.q: What did Jesus do before the sun rose?

1.a: Jesus said that he had come to preach in the surrounding towns.
1.q: What did Jesus tell Simon he had come to do?

1.a: Jesus had pity on the leper and healed him.
1.q: What attitude did Jesus have toward the leper who begged Jesus to be healed?

1.a: Jesus told the leper to go offer the sacrifices according to what Moses commanded as a testimony.
1.q: What did Jesus tell the leper to do, and why?

2.a: The men removed the roof of the house and lowered the paralyzed man to Jesus.
2.q: What did the four men do who were carrying the paralyzed man?

2.a: Jesus said, "Child, your sins are forgiven".
2.q: What did Jesus say to the paralyzed man?

2.a: Some of the scribes reasoned that Jesus had blasphemed because only God can forgive sins.
2.q: Why did some of the scribes object to what Jesus had said?

2.a: Jesus told the paralyzed man to take up his bed and go to his house, and the man did.
2.q: How did Jesus demonstrate that he had authority on earth to forgive sins?

2.a: Levi was sitting at the tax-collecting place when Jesus called him.
2.q: What was Levi doing when Jesus told Levi to follow him?

2.a: Jesus was dining with the sinful people and tax collectors.
2.q: At Levi's house, what was Jesus doing that offended the Pharisees?

2.a: Jesus said he had come to call sinful people.
2.q: Who did Jesus say he had come to call?

2.a: They asked Jesus why his disciples did not fast when John's disciples and the Pharisees' disciples did fast.
2.q: What question did some people ask Jesus about fasting?

2.a: Jesus said that while the bridegroom is still with the wedding attendants they cannot fast.
2.q: How did Jesus explain why his disciples were not fasting?

2.a: Jesus' disciples picked heads of grain and ate them on the Sabbath.
2.q: What did Jesus' disciples do in some fields on the Sabbath which offended the Pharisees?

2.a: Jesus gave the example of David who out of need ate the bread of the presence normally reserved for the priests.
2.q: What example did Jesus give of someone who needed and ate bread normally forbidden for them?

2.a: Jesus said the Sabbath was made for people.
2.q: For whom did Jesus say the Sabbath was made?

2.a: Jesus said that he was Lord also of the Sabbath.
2.q: What authority did Jesus claim for himself?

3.a: They were watching Jesus to see if he would heal on the Sabbath, so they could accuse him.
3.q: Why were they watching Jesus on the Sabbath in the synagogue?

3.a: Jesus asked the people if it was lawful to do good or to do harm on the Sabbath.
3.q: What question did Jesus ask the people about the Sabbath?
How did the people respond to Jesus' question?
What then was Jesus' attitude toward them?

3.a: The Pharisees went out and plotted to put Jesus to death.
3.q: What did the Pharisees do when Jesus healed the man?
How many people followed Jesus as he went to the sea?

3.a: The demons cried out that Jesus was the Son of God.
3.q: What did the demons cry out when they saw Jesus?

3.a: Jesus appointed twelve apostles who were to be with him, preach, and have authority to cast out demons.
3.q: How many men did Jesus appoint as apostles, and what were they to do?

3.a: The apostle that would betray Jesus was Judas Iscariot.
3.q: Who was the apostle that would betray Jesus?

3.a: Jesus' family thought that he was out of his mind.
3.q: What did Jesus' family think about the crowds and the events surrounding Jesus?

3.a: The scribes accused Jesus of driving out demons by the ruler of demons.
3.q: What accusation did the scribes make against Jesus?

3.a: Jesus responded that no kingdom divided against itself can stand.
3.q: What was Jesus' response to the scribes' accusation?

3.a: Jesus said that blasphemy against the Holy Spirit cannot be forgiven.
3.q: What sin did Jesus say cannot be forgiven?

3.a: Jesus said that his mother and brothers were those who do the will of God.
3.q: Who did Jesus say were his mother and brothers?

4.a: Jesus got into a boat to teach because a very large crowd had gathered around him.
4.q: Why did Jesus get into a boat to teach?

4.a: The birds came and devoured them.
4.q: What happened to the seeds sown on the road?

4.a: They withered away because they had no root.
4.q: What happened to the seeds sown on the rocky ground when the sun rose?
What happened to the seeds sown among thorn plants?

4.a: The seeds produced grain, yielding thirty, sixty, and some a hundred times what was planted.
4.q: What happened to the seeds sown in the good soil?

4.a: Jesus said the mystery of the kingdom of God was given to the Twelve, but not to those outside.
4.q: What did Jesus say was given to the Twelve, but not to those outside?

4.a: The seed is the word of God.
4.q: In Jesus' parable, what is the seed?

4.a: It represents those who hear the word, but immediately Satan takes it away.
4.q: What does the seed sown on the road represent?

4.a: It represents those who hear the word with joy, but when persecution comes they stumble.
4.q: What does the seed sown on the rocky ground represent?

4.a: It represents those who hear the word, but the cares of the world choke the word.
4.q: What does the seed sown among thorn plants represent?

4.a: It represents those who hear the word, receive it, and produce fruit.
4.q: What does the seed sown in the good soil represent?

4.a: Jesus said that the hidden and secret things would be brought into the light.
4.q: What did Jesus say would happen to the hidden and secret things?

4.a: The man casts the seed, and it grows, but he does not know how, then when the harvest is ripe he gathers it.
4.q: In what way is the kingdom of God like a man who casts his seed upon the ground?

4.a: The mustard seed begins as the smallest of seeds, yet grows into a great plant where many can make their nests.
4.q: In what way is the kingdom of God like a mustard seed?

4.a: A great storm began, threatening to fill the boat with water.
4.q: What happened as the disciples and Jesus crossed the lake?
What was Jesus doing at this time in the boat?

4.a: The disciples asked Jesus if he cared that they were about to die.
4.q: What question did the disciples ask Jesus?

4.a: Jesus rebuked the wind and calmed the sea.
The disciples were filled with great fear and wondered who Jesus was that the wind and sea obeyed him.
4.q: After Jesus did this, what was the response of the disciples?

5.a: A man with an unclean spirit met Jesus.
5.q: Who met Jesus when they came to the region of the Gerasenes?

5.a: When people tried to restrain this man with chains, he tore the chains apart.
5.q: What had happened when people tried to restrain this man with chains?

5.a: Jesus said to the man, "Come out of the man, you unclean spirit".
5.q: What did Jesus say to the man?

5.a: The unclean spirit called Jesus the Son of the Most High God.
5.q: What title did the unclean spirit give Jesus?

5.a: The unclean spirit's name was Army, because there were many.
5.q: What was the name of the unclean spirit?

5.a: The spirits came out and entered a herd of pigs, who ran down a steep hill and drowned in the lake.
5.q: What happened when Jesus cast out the unclean spirit from the man?

5.a: The man was sitting with Jesus, clothed and in his right mind.
5.q: After the unclean spirit was cast out, what was the condition of the man?

5.a: The people asked Jesus to leave their region.
5.q: What did the people of the region ask Jesus to do?

5.a: Jesus told the man to tell his people what the Lord had done for him.
5.q: What did Jesus tell the man who had lived in the tombs to now do?

5.a: Jairus asked Jesus to come with him to lay hands on his daughter who was near death.
5.q: What request did Jairus, the synagogue leader, make of Jesus?

5.a: The woman had suffered with a discharge of blood for twelve years.
5.q: What was the problem with the woman who touched Jesus' cloak?

5.a: The woman thought that if she just touched Jesus' clothes, she would be healed.
5.q: Why did the woman touch Jesus' cloak?

5.a: Jesus knew that power had gone out from him and looked around to see who had touched him.
5.q: What did Jesus do when the woman touched his cloak?

5.a: Jesus told her that her faith had made her well, and to go in peace.
5.q: When the woman told Jesus all the truth, what did Jesus say to her?
What was the condition of Jairus' daughter when Jesus arrived at the house?

5.a: Jesus told Jairus to not be afraid, but to just believe.
5.q: What did Jesus tell Jairus at this time?

5.a: Peter, James, and John went with Jesus into the room.
5.q: Which disciples went with Jesus into the room where the child was?

5.a: The people laughed at Jesus when he said that Jairus' daughter was only sleeping.
5.q: What did the people in the house do when Jesus said Jairus' daughter was only sleeping?

5.a: The people were greatly overcome and astonished.
5.q: When the child got up and walked, how did the people react?

6.a: The people did not know from where he got his teachings, his wisdom, and his miracles.
6.q: Why were the people of Jesus' home town shocked about him?

6.a: Jesus said a prophet is without honor in his home town, among his relatives, and in his own household.
6.q: Where did Jesus say a prophet is without honor?

6.a: Jesus was amazed by the unbelief of the people in his home town.
6.q: What amazed Jesus about the people in his home town?

6.a: Jesus gave the Twelve authority over unclean spirits.
6.q: What authority did Jesus give the Twelve as he sent them out?

6.a: The Twelve took a staff, sandals, and one tunic.
6.q: What did the Twelve take with them on their journey?

6.a: Jesus told the Twelve to shake off the dust under their feet as a testimony against them.
6.q: What did Jesus tell the Twelve to do if a place did not receive them?

6.a: The people supposed that Jesus was John the Baptizer, or Elijah, or a prophet.
6.q: Who did the people suppose Jesus was?

6.a: John had told Herod it was unlawful for Herod to marry his brother's wife.
6.q: What had John the Baptizer told Herod he was doing unlawfully?

6.a: Herod became upset when he heard John preach, but he was still glad to hear him.
6.q: How did Herod react when he heard John preach?

6.a: Herod swore that she could have whatever she asked of him, up to half of his kingdom.
6.q: What oath did Herod swear to Herodias?

6.a: Herodias asked for the head of John the Baptizer on a platter.
6.q: For what did Herodias ask?

6.a: Herod became very sorry, but did not refuse her request because of the oaths he had made in front of his guests.
6.q: How did Herod react to Herodias' request?

6.a: Many people recognized them and ran to arrive there before Jesus and the apostles.
6.q: What happened when Jesus and the apostles tried to go away by themselves to rest?

6.a: Jesus had compassion on them because they were like sheep without a shepherd.
6.q: What was Jesus' attitude toward the crowd that was waiting for them?

6.a: The disciples thought they would have to go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread.
6.q: When asked by Jesus, what did the disciples think they would have to do to feed the people?

6.a: The disciples already had five loaves and two fish with them.
6.q: What food did the disciples already have with them?

6.a: As he took the loaves and fish, Jesus looked up to heaven, blessed and broke the loaves, and gave them to his disciples.
6.q: What did Jesus do as he took the loaves and fish?

6.a: There were twelve baskets of bread, and pieces of fish left after everyone ate.
6.q: How much food was left after everyone ate?

6.a: There were five thousand men that had been fed.
6.q: How many men had been fed?

6.a: Jesus came to the disciples walking on the lake.
6.q: How did Jesus come to the disciples on the lake?

6.a: Jesus told the disciples to be brave and to not be afraid.
6.q: What did Jesus tell the disciples when they saw him?

6.a: The disciples did not understand about the miracle of the loaves because their minds were slow to understand.
6.q: Why did the disciples not understand about the miracle of the loaves?

6.a: The people brought the sick on stretchers to Jesus wherever they heard he was coming.
6.q: What did the people of the region do when they recognized Jesus?

6.a: Those who just touched the fringe of Jesus' garment were healed.
6.q: What happened to those who just touched the fringe of Jesus' garment?

7.a: Some of the disciples were eating with unwashed hands.
7.q: What were some of Jesus' disciples doing that offended the Pharisees and scribes?

7.a: It was the tradition of the elders that hands, cups, pots, copper vessels, and dining couches be washed before eating.
7.q: Whose tradition was it that hands, cups, pots, copper vessels, and dining couches be washed before eating?

7.a: Jesus said that the Pharisees and scribes taught the rules of men while abandoning the commandment of God.
7.q: What did Jesus say to the Pharisees and scribes about their teaching on the issue of washing?

7.a: They voided God's commandment by telling people to give to them as Corban the money that would have helped their father and mother.
7.q: How did the Pharisees and scribes void the commandment of God which says to honor your father and mother?

7.a: Jesus said that nothing from outside of a person can defile him when it enters into him.
7.q: What did Jesus say does not defile a person?

7.a: Jesus said that what comes out of a person defiles him.
7.q: What did Jesus say defiles a person?

7.a: Jesus said that evil thoughts, sexual immorality, theft, murder, adultery, coveting, wickedness, deceit, sensuality, envy, slander, pride, and folly can come out of a person to defile him.
7.q: What are three things that Jesus said can come out of a person to defile him?

7.a: Jesus declared all foods to be clean.
7.q: What kinds of foods did Jesus declare to be clean?

7.a: The woman whose daughter had an unclean spirit was a Greek.
7.q: Was the woman whose daughter had an unclean spirit a Jew or a Greek?

7.a: The woman said that even the dogs under the table eat the children's crumbs.
7.q: How did the woman respond when Jesus told her that it was not right to take the children's bread and throw it to the dogs?

7.a: Jesus cast the demon out of the woman's daughter.
7.q: What did Jesus do for the woman?

7.a: Jesus put his fingers in the man's ears, spit and touched his tongue, then looked to heaven and said, "Open!"
7.q: When the man who was deaf and had a speech impediment was brought to Jesus, what did he do to heal him?

7.a: The more Jesus commanded them to be quiet, the more they talked about it.
7.q: What did the people do when Jesus told them to tell no one about his healings?

8.a: Jesus stated that he was concerned the great crowd had nothing to eat.
8.q: What concern did Jesus state about the great crowd that had been following him?

8.a: The disciples had seven loaves with them.
8.q: How many loaves did the disciples have with them?

8.a: Jesus gave thanks, broke the loaves, and gave them to his disciples to serve.
8.q: What did Jesus do with the disciples' loaves?

8.a: There were about four thousand men who ate and were satisfied.
8.q: How many people ate and were satisfied?

8.a: There were seven baskets of food remaining after everyone had eaten.
8.q: How much food remained after everyone had eaten?

8.a: The Pharisees wanted Jesus to give them a sign from heaven.
8.q: To test him, what did the Pharisees want Jesus to do?

8.a: Jesus warned his disciples to be on guard of the yeast of the Pharisees.
8.q: About what did Jesus warn his disciples concerning the Pharisees?

8.a: The disciples thought Jesus was talking about the fact that they had forgotten to bring bread.
8.q: About what did the disciples think Jesus was talking?

8.a: Jesus reminded them that when he had broken five loaves, five thousand people had been fed and twelves baskets full of broken pieces had been taken up.
8.q: Jesus reminded his disciples that what had happened when Jesus had broken five loaves?

8.a: Jesus first spat on his eyes and laid his hands upon him.
8.q: What two things did Jesus first do to the blind man in order to restore his sight?

8.a: Jesus laid his hands upon his eyes.
8.q: What third thing did Jesus do to the blind man in order to completely restore his sight?

8.a: The people were saying that Jesus was John the Baptizer, Elijah, or one of the prophets.
8.q: Who were the people saying that Jesus was?

8.a: Peter said that Jesus was the Christ.
8.q: Who did Peter say that Jesus was?

8.a: Jesus taught his disciples that the Son of Man must suffer, be rejected, be killed, and be raised after three days.
8.q: About what future events did Jesus begin to teach his disciples clearly?

8.a: Jesus said to Peter, "Get behind me Satan! You do not care for the things of God, but for the things of people".
8.q: What did Jesus say when Peter began to rebuke him?

8.a: Jesus said that anyone who wants to follow him must deny himself and take up his cross.
8.q: What did Jesus say anyone who wants to follow him must do?

8.a: Jesus said, "What does it profit a person to gain the whole world, and then forfeit his life?"
8.q: What did Jesus say about a person's desire to gain the things of the world?

8.a: Jesus said that at his coming he would be ashamed of those who were ashamed of him and his words.
8.q: What did Jesus say he would do concerning those who are ashamed of him and his words?

9.a: Jesus said that some standing there with him would not die before they saw the kingdom of God coming with power.
9.q: Who did Jesus say would see the kingdom of God coming with power?

9.a: Jesus was transfigured and his garments became radiantly brilliant.
9.q: What happened to Jesus when Peter, James, and John went up a high mountain with him?

9.a: Elijah and Moses were talking with Jesus.
9.q: Who was talking with Jesus on the mountain?

9.a: The voice said, "This is my beloved Son. Listen to him".
9.q: On the mountain, what did the voice from the cloud say?

9.a: Jesus commanded them to tell no one what they had seen, until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.
9.q: What did Jesus command the disciples about what they had seen on the mountain?

9.a: Jesus said that Elijah does come first to restore all things, and that Elijah had already come.
9.q: What did Jesus say about Elijah's coming?

9.a: The disciples were unable to drive out the evil spirit from the father's son.
9.q: What were the disciples unable to do for the father and his son?

9.a: The evil spirit threw the boy into the fire or into the waters to try to destroy him.
9.q: Into what did the evil spirit throw the boy to try to destroy him?

9.a: The father responded, "I believe! Help my unbelief!"
9.q: How did the father respond when Jesus said all things are possible for the one who believes?

9.a: The disciples were unable to cast out the spirit because it could not be cast out except by prayer.
9.q: Why were the disciples unable to cast out the mute and deaf spirit in the boy?

9.a: Jesus told them he would be put to death, then after three days he would rise again.
9.q: What did Jesus tell his disciples would happen to him?

9.a: The disciples were arguing about who among them was the greatest.
9.q: What were the disciples arguing about along the way?

9.a: Jesus said that he is first who is servant of all.
9.q: Who did Jesus say is first?

9.a: When someone receives a little child in Jesus' name, they are also receiving Jesus and the one who sent Jesus.
9.q: When someone receives a little child in Jesus' name, who are they also receiving?

9.a: It would be better for that one if a millstone were tied around his neck and he was thrown into the sea.
9.q: What would be better for someone who causes a little one who believes in Jesus to stumble?

9.a: Jesus said to tear out your eye if it causes you to stumble.
9.q: What did Jesus say to do with your eye if it causes you to stumble?

9.a: Jesus said that in hell the worm does not die, and the fire is not put out.
9.q: What did Jesus say happens in hell?

10.a: The Pharisees asked Jesus if it was lawful for a husband to divorce his wife.
10.q: What question did the Pharisees ask Jesus in order to test him?

10.a: Moses had allowed a man to write a certificate of divorce and then send his wife away.
10.q: What commandment had Moses given the Jews concerning divorce?

10.a: Moses had given this commandment to the Jews because of their hard hearts.
10.q: Why had Moses given the Jews this commandment concerning divorce?

10.a: Jesus referred to the creation of male and female at the beginning when telling about God's original design for marriage.
10.q: To what event in history did Jesus refer when telling the Pharisees about God's original design for marriage?

10.a: Jesus said that the two become one flesh.
10.q: What did Jesus say the two people, the man and his wife, become when they are married?

10.a: Jesus said that what God joins together, let no man tear apart.
10.q: What did Jesus say about what God joins together in marriage?

10.a: Jesus was angry with the disciples and told them to permit the little children to come to him.
10.q: What was Jesus' reaction when the disciples rebuked those bringing little children to him?

10.a: Jesus said the kingdom of God must be received as a little child in order to enter it.
10.q: How did Jesus say the kingdom of God must be received in order to enter it?

10.a: Jesus told the man he must not kill, not commit adultery, not steal, not testify falsely, not defraud, and must honor his father and mother.
10.q: What did Jesus first tell the man he must do to inherit eternal life?

10.a: Jesus then commanded the man to sell at that he had and to follow him.
10.q: What additional commandment did Jesus then give the man?

10.a: The man was sorrowful and walked away, for he had many possessions.
10.q: How did the man react when Jesus gave him this commandment, and why?

10.a: Jesus said that the rich had great difficulty entering the kingdom of God.
10.q: Who did Jesus say had great difficulty entering the kingdom of God?

10.a: Jesus said that with people it is impossible, but with God all things are possible.
10.q: How did Jesus say even a rich person could be saved?

10.a: Jesus said they would receive a hundred times as much in this world, with persecutions, and eternal life in the world to come.
10.q: What did Jesus say anyone would receive who had left house, family, and lands for Jesus' sake?

10.a: Jesus and the disciples were traveling on the road going up to Jerusalem.
10.q: On what road were Jesus and the disciples traveling?

10.a: Jesus told his disciples that he would be condemned to death, and after three days he would rise.
10.q: What did Jesus tell his disciples would happen to him in Jerusalem?

10.a: James and John requested to sit on Jesus' right and left hand with him in glory.
10.q: What request did James and John make to Jesus?

10.a: Jesus said that James and John would endure the cup Jesus would drink, and the baptism with which Jesus would be baptized.
10.q: What did Jesus say that James and John would endure?

10.a: No, Jesus said that the seats at his right and left hand were not his to give.
10.q: Did Jesus grant the request of James and John?

10.a: Jesus said that the rulers of the Gentiles dominate their subjects.
10.q: How did Jesus say the rulers of the Gentiles treat their subjects?

10.a: Jesus said those who wish to be great among the disciples must be servant of all.
10.q: How did Jesus say those who wish to be great among the disciples must live?

10.a: Bartimaeus cried out all the more, "Son of David, have mercy on me!"
10.q: What did the blind man Bartimaeus do when many rebuked him, telling him to be quiet?

10.a: Jesus said that Bartimaeus' faith had healed him.
10.q: What did Jesus say had healed Bartimaeus of his blindness?

11.a: Jesus sent them to bring a colt to him that had never been ridden.
11.q: What did Jesus send two of his disciples to do in the village opposite them?

11.a: Some people asked the disciples what they were doing, so they spoke to the people as Jesus told them, and the people let them go their way.
11.q: What happened when the disciples untied the colt?

11.a: The people spread their garments, and branches they had cut from the fields.
11.q: What did the people spread on the road as Jesus rode on the colt?

11.a: The people were shouting that the kingdom of their father David was coming.
11.q: What coming kingdom were the people shouting about as Jesus rode toward Jerusalem?

11.a: Jesus looked around and then went out to Bethany.
11.q: What did Jesus do when he entered the temple area?

11.a: Jesus said to the fig tree, "No one will ever eat fruit from you".
11.q: What did Jesus do when he saw the fig tree with no fruit on it?

11.a: Jesus cast out the sellers and purchasers, and would not allow anyone to carry merchandise through the temple.
11.q: What did Jesus do when he entered the temple area this time?

11.a: Jesus said that the temple was supposed to be a house of prayer for all the nations.
11.q: What did Jesus say the temple was supposed to be, according to Scripture?

11.a: Jesus said they had made the temple a den of robbers.
11.q: What did Jesus say the chief priests and scribes had made the temple?

11.a: The chief priests and scribes were trying to kill Jesus.
11.q: What were the chief priests and scribes trying to do to Jesus?

11.a: The fig tree to which Jesus had spoken withered away to its roots.
11.q: What happened to the fig tree to which Jesus had spoken?

11.a: Jesus said that everything we ask for in prayer, believe that we have received it, and it will be ours.
11.q: What did Jesus say about everything we ask for in prayer?

11.a: Jesus said we must forgive whatever we have against anyone, so that the Father will also forgive us.
11.q: What did Jesus say we must do so that the Father in heaven will also forgive you?

11.a: They wanted to know by what authority he did the things he was doing.
11.q: In the temple, what did the chief priests, scribes, and elders want to know from Jesus?

11.a: Jesus asked them if John's baptism was from heaven or from men.
11.q: What question did Jesus ask the chief priests, scribes, and elders?

11.a: They did not want to give this answer because Jesus would ask why they didn't believe John.
11.q: Why did the chief priests, scribes, and elders not want to answer that John's baptism was from heaven?

11.a: They did not want to give this answer because they feared the people, who all believed that John was a prophet.
11.q: Why did the chief priests, scribes, and elders not want to answer that John's baptism was from men?

12.a: After building and leasing the vineyard, the owner went away on a journey.
12.q: After building and leasing the vineyard, what did the owner do?

12.a: The vine dressers beat some and killed some of the many servants.
12.q: What did the vine dressers do to the many servants that the owner sent to receive the fruit of the vineyard?

12.a: The owner sent his beloved son last.
12.q: Who did the owner send last to the vine dressers?

12.a: The vine dressers seized him, killed him, and threw him out of the vineyard.
12.q: What did the vine dressers do with the one sent last by the owner?

12.a: The owner of the vineyard will come and destroy the vine dressers and give the vineyard to others.
12.q: What will the owner of the vineyard do to the vine dressers?

12.a: The stone which the builders rejected has been made the cornerstone.
12.q: In the scripture, what happens to the stone which the builders rejected?

12.a: They asked him if it was lawful to pay taxes to Caesar or not.
12.q: What question did the Pharisees and some of the Herodians ask Jesus?

12.a: Jesus said they should give to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God, the things that are God's.
12.q: How did Jesus answer their question?

12.a: The Sadducees did not believe in the resurrection.
12.q: In what did the Sadducees not believe?
In the story told by the Sadducees, how many husbands did the woman have?

12.a: They asked which of the men would be the woman's husband in the resurrection.
12.q: What question did the Sadducees ask Jesus about the woman?

12.a: Jesus said that the Sadducees did not know the scriptures nor the power of God.
12.q: What reason did Jesus give the Sadducees for their error?

12.a: Jesus said that in the resurrection, men and women will not marry, but will be like angels.
12.q: What was Jesus' answer to the Sadducees' question about the woman?

12.a: Jesus quoted from the book of Moses, where God says that he is the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob - all who must then be still alive.
12.q: How did Jesus show from the scriptures that there is a resurrection?

12.a: Jesus said that to love the Lord your God with all your heart, soul, mind, and strength is the most important commandment.
12.q: What commandment did Jesus say is most important?

12.a: Jesus said that to love your neighbor as yourself is the second commandment.
12.q: What commandment did Jesus say is second?

12.a: Jesus asked how David could call the Christ Lord when the Christ is the son of David.
12.q: What question did Jesus ask the scribes about David?

12.a: Jesus said that the scribes desire to be honored by men, but they devour widows' houses, and make long prayers for people to see.
12.q: What did Jesus tell the people to beware of concerning the scribes?

12.a: Jesus said she had contributed more because she gave out of her poverty while the others gave out of their abundance.
12.q: Why did Jesus say that the poor widow had put in more than all who contributed to the offering box?

13.a: Jesus said that not one stone would be left on another which would not be torn down.
13.q: What did Jesus say would happen to the wonderful stones and buildings of the temple?

13.a: The disciples asked Jesus when these things would happen and what would be the sign.
13.q: What question did the disciples then ask Jesus?

13.a: Jesus said the disciples must be careful that no one lead them astray.
13.q: About what did Jesus say the disciples must be careful?

13.a: Jesus said the beginning of birth pains would be wars, rumors of wars, earthquakes, and famines.
13.q: What did Jesus say would be the beginnings of birth pains?

13.a: Jesus said that the disciples would be delivered to councils, beaten in synagogues, and would stand before governors and kings as a testimony.
13.q: What did Jesus say would happen to the disciples?

13.a: Jesus said the gospel must be preached to all the nations first.
13.q: What did Jesus say must happen first?

13.a: Jesus said that one family member would deliver up another family member to death.
13.q: What did Jesus say would happen between family members?

13.a: Jesus said that whoever endures to the end would be saved.
13.q: Who did Jesus say would be saved?

13.a: Jesus said that those in Judea should flee to the mountains when they see the abomination of desolation.
13.q: What did Jesus say those in Judea should do when they see the abomination of desolation?

13.a: Jesus said the Lord would shorten the days of tribulation for the sake of the elect.
13.q: What did Jesus say the Lord would do for the sake of the elect, so that they would be saved?

13.a: Jesus said that false Christs and false prophets would arise to deceive people.
13.q: Who did Jesus say would arise to deceive people?

13.a: The sun and moon will be darkened, the stars will fall from the sky, and the powers in the heavens will be shaken.
13.q: What will happen to the powers in the heavens after the tribulation of those days?

13.a: They will see the Son of Man coming in the clouds with great power and glory.
13.q: What will the people see in the clouds?

13.a: The Son of Man will gather his elect from the ends of the earth and the sky.
13.q: What will the Son of Man do when he comes?

13.a: Jesus said that this generation would not pass away until all of these things occurred.
13.q: What did Jesus say would not pass away until all of these things occurred?

13.a: Jesus said that his words would never pass away.
13.q: What did Jesus say would never pass away?

13.a: Jesus said that no one knows the day or hour, except the Father.
13.q: When did Jesus say all these things would happen?

13.a: Jesus told his disciples to be alert and watch.
13.q: What command did Jesus give his disciples regarding his coming?

14.a: They were considering how to stealthily arrest Jesus and then kill him.
14.q: What were the chief priests and scribes considering how to do?

14.a: They were worried that a riot would arise among the people.
14.q: Why did the chief priests and scribes not want to act during the Feast of Unleavened Bread?

14.a: A woman broke a vial of costly liquid and poured it on Jesus' head.
14.q: What did a woman do to Jesus at the house of Simon the leper?

14.a: Some were rebuking the woman for not selling the perfume and giving the money to the poor.
14.q: For what were some rebuking the woman?

14.a: Jesus said the woman had anointed his body for burial.
14.q: What did Jesus say the woman had done for him?

14.a: Jesus promised that wherever the gospel was preached in the whole world, what the woman had done would be spoken of in memory of her.
14.q: What promise did Jesus make about what the woman had done?

14.a: Judas Iscariot went away to the chief priests so that he might deliver Jesus to them.
14.q: Why did Judas Iscariot go away to the chief priests?

14.a: Jesus told them to go into the city and follow a man carrying a pitcher of water, and then ask him where the guest room was that they would use to eat the Passover.
14.q: How did the disciples find the place where they would all eat the Passover?

14.a: Jesus said that one of the disciples eating with him would betray him.
14.q: What did Jesus say as they were reclining at the table and eating?

14.a: Jesus said that the disciple dipping bread with him in the bowl would betray him.
14.q: Which disciple did Jesus say would betray him?

14.a: Jesus said that it would have been better for him if he had not been born.
14.q: What did Jesus say about the destiny of the disciple who betrayed him?

14.a: Jesus said, "Take this. This is my body".
14.q: What did Jesus say as he gave the disciples the broken bread?

14.a: Jesus said, "This is my blood of the covenant, the blood that is poured out for many".
14.q: What did Jesus say as he gave the disciples the cup?

14.a: Jesus said he would again drink of this fruit of the vine on the day when he drank it anew in the kingdom of God.
14.q: When did Jesus say he would again drink of this fruit of the vine?

14.a: Jesus predicted that his disciples would all fall away because of him.
14.q: At the Mount of Olives, what did Jesus predict about his disciples?

14.a: Jesus told Peter that before the rooster crowed twice, Peter would deny Jesus three times.
14.q: What did Jesus tell Peter after Peter said he would never fall away?

14.a: Jesus told them to remain there and watch.
14.q: What did Jesus tell his three disciples to do while he prayed?

14.a: Jesus prayed that this hour might pass from him.
14.q: For what did Jesus pray?

14.a: Jesus was willing to accept whatever the Father's will was for him.
14.q: What was Jesus willing to accept as an answer to his prayer to the Father?

14.a: Jesus found the three disciples sleeping.
14.q: What did Jesus find when he returned to the three disciples?

14.a: Jesus found the three disciples sleeping.
14.q: What did Jesus find the second time he returned from praying?

14.a: Jesus found the three disciples sleeping.
14.q: What did Jesus find the third time he returned from praying?

14.a: Judas kissed Jesus to show which person was Jesus.
14.q: What sign did Judas give to show the guards which person was Jesus?

14.a: Jesus said that scripture was being fulfilled because they came to arrest him like a robber, with swords and clubs.
14.q: What did Jesus say was being done in his arrest to fulfill scripture?

14.a: Those with Jesus left him and fled.
14.q: What did those with Jesus do when Jesus was arrested?

14.a: The young man left his linen garment there and ran away naked.
14.q: What did a young man who was following Jesus do when Jesus was arrested?

14.a: Peter sat among the guards, near a fire to keep warm.
14.q: Where was Peter as Jesus was taken to the high priest?

14.a: The testimony against Jesus was false and did not agree.
14.q: What was wrong with the testimony against Jesus given to the Council?

14.a: The high priest asked Jesus if he was the Christ, the son of the Blessed.
14.q: What question did the high priest ask Jesus about who Jesus was?

14.a: Jesus answered that he was the Christ, the son of the Blessed.
14.q: What was Jesus' answer to the high priest's question?

14.a: The high priest said that Jesus was guilty of blasphemy.
14.q: Hearing Jesus' answer, of what did the high priest say Jesus was guilty?

14.a: They spit on him, struck him, and beat him.
14.q: What did they do to Jesus after condemning him as one who deserved death?

14.a: Peter answered that he did not know or understand about what the girl was talking.
14.q: What was Peter's answer to the servant girl who said that Peter was with Jesus?

14.a: Peter swore and put himself under curses that he did not know Jesus.
14.q: What was Peter's response when he was asked a third time if he was one of Jesus' disciples?

14.a: After Peter answered the third time, the rooster crowed a second time.
14.q: What happened after Peter answered the third time?

14.a: After he heard the rooster, Peter broke down and wept.
14.q: What did Peter do after he heard the rooster?

15.a: Early in the morning, they bound Jesus and handed him over to Pilate.
15.q: Early in the morning, what did the chief priests do with Jesus?

15.a: Pilate was amazed that Jesus no longer answered him.
15.q: While the chief priests were presenting many charges against Jesus, what amazed Pilate about Jesus?

15.a: Pilate usually released to the crowd one prisoner they requested at the time of the feast.
15.q: What did Pilate usually do for the crowd at the time of the feast?

15.a: Pilate knew that it was because of envy that the chief priests had handed Jesus over to him.
15.q: Why did Pilate want to release Jesus to the crowd?

15.a: The crowd cried out for Barabbas to be released.
15.q: Who did the crowd cry out to be released?

15.a: The crowd said that the King of the Jews should be crucified.
15.q: What did the crowd say should be done with the King of the Jews?

15.a: The soldiers put a purple robe on Jesus and put on him a twisted crown of thorns.
15.q: How did the cohort of soldiers dress Jesus?

15.a: A passerby, Simon of Cyrene, was forced to carry Jesus' cross.
15.q: Who carried Jesus' cross?

15.a: The name of the place was Golgotha, which means Place of a Skull.
15.q: What was the name of the place where the soldiers brought Jesus to crucify him?

15.a: The soldiers cast lots for Jesus' garments.
15.q: What did the soldiers do with Jesus' garments?

15.a: The soldiers wrote "The King of the Jews" on the sign.
15.q: What charge against Jesus did the soldiers write on the sign?

15.a: Those who passed by challenged Jesus to save himself and get down from the cross.
15.q: What did those who passed by challenge Jesus to do?

15.a: The chief priests said that Jesus should come down from the cross so they would believe.
15.q: What did the chief priests say Jesus should do so they would believe?

15.a: The chief priests called Jesus the Christ and the King of Israel.
15.q: What titles did the chief priests use for Jesus as they mocked him?

15.a: At the sixth hour, darkness came over the whole land.
15.q: What happened at the sixth hour?

15.a: Jesus cried out, "My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?"
15.q: What did Jesus cry out at the ninth hour?

15.a: Jesus cried out with a loud voice before he died.
15.q: What did Jesus do before he died?

15.a: The curtain of the temple was split in two from top to bottom when Jesus died.
15.q: What happened in the temple when Jesus died?

15.a: The centurion testified that truly this man was the Son of God.
15.q: What did the centurion testify when he saw how Jesus died?

15.a: Jesus died on the day before the Sabbath.
15.q: On what day did Jesus die?

15.a: Joseph of Arimathea took Jesus down from the cross, wrapped him in linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb, rolling a stone against the entrance of the tomb.
15.q: What did Joseph of Arimathea do after Jesus died?

16.a: The women went to the tomb on the first day of the week when the sun came up.
16.q: When did the women go to Jesus' tomb to anoint his body?

16.a: Someone had rolled away the very large stone from the entrance.
16.q: How did the women enter the tomb even though there had been a very large stone at the entrance?

16.a: The women saw a young man dressed in a white robe sitting on the right side.
16.q: What did the women see when they entered the tomb?

16.a: The young man said that Jesus was risen and was not there.
16.q: What did the young man say about Jesus?

16.a: The young man said the disciples would meet Jesus in Galilee.
16.q: Where did the young man say the disciples would meet Jesus?

16.a: Jesus first appeared to Mary Magdalene.
16.q: To whom did Jesus first appear after his resurrection?
How did Jesus' disciples respond when Mary told them she had seen Jesus alive?
How did Jesus' disciples respond when two other people told them they had seen Jesus alive?

16.a: Jesus rebuked the disciples for their unbelief.
16.q: When he appeared to the disciples, what did Jesus say to them about their unbelief?

16.a: Jesus commanded the disciples to go into all the world and preach the gospel.
16.q: What command did Jesus give the disciples?

16.a: Jesus said those who believed and were baptized would be saved.
16.q: Who did Jesus say would be saved?

16.a: Jesus said those who did not believe would be condemned.
16.q: Who did Jesus say would be condemned?

16.a: Jesus said those who believed would cast out demons, would speak in new languages, would not be hurt by anything deadly, and would heal others.
16.q: What signs did Jesus say would go with those who believed?

16.a: After he spoke to the disciples, Jesus was taken up into heaven and sat down at the right hand of God.
16.q: What happened to Jesus after he spoke to the disciples?

16.a: The disciples then left and preached everywhere.
16.q: What did the disciples then do?

16.a: The Lord then worked with the disciples and confirmed the word with miraculous signs.
16.q: What did the Lord then do?
